DOC.brief_title: 40 % Orally Administered Dextrose Gel More Effective Than 25 % Dextrose
DOC.detailed_description: During study period around 2000 term neonate bear university affiliate hospital . Five 7 term neonate assess weekly principal investigator ( PI ) study eligibility . The parent neonates meet inclusion criterion receive information study invite participate . Written inform consent parent obtain . The PI enter data online Research Randomizer provide randomization number correspond numbered treatment pack contain two syrinx , contain 2ml identical therefore blind liquid . Study investigator , clinical staff , parent monitor remain blinded treatment allocation data analysis complete . To ensure standardization included term infant breastfeed 30 ' prior heel stick standardize heel lance used.Each infant take separate room mother assign nurse provide quite environment . All infant awake time procedure . Their clothes remove wet diaper change . In group , infant place supine position change table . Dextrose administration heel stick undertaken experienced staff neonatal nurse . The heel warm warm wet towel 2 ' minute procedure . The heel disinfect shortly procedure start .
DOC.criteria: bear ≥ 37 week gestation APGAR score ≥ 7 five minute birth postnatal age ≥ 72 hour breastfed ( 30 ' prior test HS ) undergo routine heel stick metabolic screen third fifth postnatal day kind medical instability need transfer neonatal intensive care unit ( NICU ) severe intrapartum asphyxia define 5 ' Apgar score less 3 parenteral nutrition presence neurological symptom congenital anomaly condition require treatment hypo hyperglycemia heel lance procedure fail
